data: With rifle on shoulder and knife in belt, Nat Wolfe rode along carelessly, for it was midday, and the country was open.
"With rifle on shoulder and knife in belt, Nat Wolfe rode along carelessly, for it was midday, and the country was open."
“With rifle on shoulder and knife in belt, Nat Wolfe rode along carelessly, for it was midday, and the country was open.”
Nat Wolfe; or, The gold hunters: A romance of Pike's Peak and New York
